001package imagingbook.common.math.eigen;
002
003import static imagingbook.common.math.Matrix.isSquare;
004import static imagingbook.common.math.Matrix.sameSize;
005
006import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
007import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
008import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
009
010import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
011
012/**
013 * <p>
014 * Solves the generalized eigenproblem of the form A x = &lambda; B x,
015 * for square matrices A, B.
016 * </p>
017 * <p>
018 * This implementation was ported from original EISPACK code [1] using
019 * a finite state machine concept [2] to untangle Fortran's GOTO
020 * statements (which are not available in Java), with some inspirations from
021 * <a href="https://github.com/accord-net/framework/blob/development/Sources/Accord.Math/Decompositions/GeneralizedEigenvalueDecomposition.cs">
022 * this implementation</a>.
023 * See 
024 * <a href="https://mipav.cit.nih.gov/">mipav.cit.nih.gov</a> 
025 * (file {@code gov.nih.mipav.model.structures.jama.GeneralizedEigenvalue.java}) 
026 * for another Java implementation based on EISPACK.
027 * </p>
028 * 
029 * <p>
030 * Note: Results have limited accuracy. For some reason the first eigenvalue/-vector (k=0) is reasonably
031 * accurate, but the remaining ones are not. 
032 * If matrices A, B are symmetric and B is positive definite, better use 
033 * {@link GeneralizedSymmetricEigenDecomposition} instead, which is more accurate.
034 * 
035 * TODO: Check complex-valued eigenvectors.
036 * </p>
037 * 
038 * <p>
039 * [1] http://www.netlib.no/netlib/eispack/
040 * <br>
041 * [2] D. E. Knuth, "Structured Programming with Goto Statements", Computing Surveys, Vol. 6, No. 4 (1974).
042 *
043 * @author WB
044 * @version 2022/06/21
045 * @see GeneralizedSymmetricEigenDecomposition
046 */
047public class GeneralizedEigenDecomposition implements RealEigenDecomposition {
048        
049        static boolean VERBOSE = false;
050
051        private int n;
052        private double[] alphaR;
053        private double[] alphaI;
054        private double[] beta;
055        private double[][] Z;
056
057        /**
058         * Constructor.
059         * @param A first matrix
060         * @param B second matrix
061         */
062        public GeneralizedEigenDecomposition(RealMatrix A, RealMatrix B) {
063                this(A.getData(), B.getData());
064        }
065
066        /**
067         * Constructor.
068         * @param A first matrix
069         * @param B second matrix
070         */
071        public GeneralizedEigenDecomposition(double[][] A, double[][] B) {
072                if (!isSquare(A) || !isSquare(B) || !sameSize(A, B)) {
073                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("matrices A, B must be square and of same size");
074                }
075
076                this.n = A.length;
077                this.alphaR = new double[n];
078                this.alphaI = new double[n];
079                this.beta = new double[n];
080                this.Z = new double[n][n];
081                
082                // a, b are modified by EISPACK routines:
083                double[][] a = Matrix.duplicate(A);
084                double[][] b = Matrix.duplicate(B);             
085                boolean matz = true;
086
087                QZHES.qzhes(a, b, matz, Z);
088                int ierr = QZIT.qzit(a, b, 0, matz, Z);
089                if (ierr >= 0) {
090                        throw new RuntimeException("limit of 30*n iterations exhausted for eigenvalue " + ierr);
091                }
092                QZVAL.qzval(a, b, alphaR, alphaI, beta, matz, Z);
093                QZVEC.qzvec(a, b, alphaR, alphaI, beta, Z);
094        }
095
096        /**
097         * Returns a vector with the real parts of the eigenvalues.
098         * 
099         * @return the real parts of the eigenvalues
100         */
101        @Override
102        public double[] getRealEigenvalues() {
103                double[] eval = new double[n];
104                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
105                        eval[i] = alphaR[i] / beta[i];
106                }
107                return eval;
108        }
109
110        @Override
111        public double getRealEigenvalue(int k) {
112                return alphaR[k] / beta[k];
113        }
114        
115        /**
116         * Returns a vector with the imaginary parts of the eigenvalues.
117         * 
118         * @return the imaginary parts of the eigenvalues
119         */
120        public double[] getImagEigenvalues() {
121                double[] eval = new double[n];
122                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++)
123                        eval[i] = alphaI[i] / beta[i];
124                return eval;
125        }
126
127        /**
128         * Return the matrix of eigenvectors, which are its column
129         * vectors.
130         * TODO: not implemented/checked for complex eigenvalues yet!
131         * 
132         * @return the matrix of eigenvectors
133         */
134        @Override
135        public RealMatrix getV() {
136                return MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(Z);
137        }
138
139        /**
140         * Returns the specified eigenvector.
141         * TODO: not implemented for complex eigenvalues yet!
142         * 
143         * @param k index
144         * @return the kth eigenvector
145         */
146        public RealVector getEigenvector(int k) {
147                return MatrixUtils.createRealVector(Matrix.getColumn(Z, k));
148        }
149        
150        /**
151     * Returns whether the calculated eigenvalues are complex or real.
152     * The method performs a zero check on each element of the
153     * {@link #getImagEigenvalues()} array and returns {@code true} if any
154     * element is not equal to zero.
155     *
156     * @return {@code true} if any of the eigenvalues is complex, {@code false} otherwise
157     */
158        @Override
159        public boolean hasComplexEigenvalues() {
160                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
161                        if (alphaI[i] != 0.0) {
162                                return true;
163                        }
164                }
165                return false;
166        }
167
168        /**
169         * Returns the block diagonal eigenvalue matrix D.
170         * TODO: check complex case!
171         * @return the block diagonal eigenvalue matrix
172         */
173        @Override
174        public RealMatrix getD() {
175                double[][] x = new double[n][n];
176
177                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++)
178                {
179                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++)
180                                x[i][j] = 0.0;
181
182                        x[i][i] = alphaR[i] / beta[i];
183                        if (alphaI[i] > 0)
184                                x[i][ i + 1] = alphaI[i] / beta[i];
185                        else if (alphaI[i] < 0)
186                                x[i][ i - 1] = alphaI[i] / beta[i];
187                }
188
189                return MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(x);
190        }
191        
192        // ----------------------------------------------------------
193        
194        // unused methods from 
195        // https://github.com/accord-net/framework/blob/development/Sources/Accord.Math/Decompositions/GeneralizedEigenvalueDecomposition.cs
196        
197        /**
198         * This method checks if any of the generated betas is zero. It does not says
199         * that the problem is singular, but only that one of the matrices 
200         * A, B is singular.
201         * 
202         * @return true if A or B is singular
203         */
204        public boolean isSingular() {
205                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
206                        if (beta[i] == 0)
207                                return true;
208                }
209                return false;
210        }
211
212        /**
213         * Returns true if the eigenvalue problem is degenerate (i.e., ill-posed).
214         * 
215         * @return true if degenerate
216         */
217        public boolean IsDegenerate() {
218                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
219                        if (beta[i] == 0 && alphaR[i] == 0)
220                                return true;
221                }
222                return false;
223        }
224
225        // ----------------------------------------------------------
226
227
228//      public static void main(String[] args) {

334
335// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
336
337abstract class QZHES {
338        
339        // EISPACK Routines, see http://www.netlib.org/eispack/
340        
341        /**
342         * <p>
343         * This subroutine is the first step of the qz algorithm for solving generalized
344         * matrix eigenvalue problems, SIAM J. Numer. Anal. 10, 241-256 (1973) by Moler
345         * and Stewart. This description has been adapted from the original version
346         * (dated August 1983).
347         * </p>
348         * <p>
349         * This subroutine accepts a pair of real general matrices and reduces one of
350         * them to upper Hessenberg form and the other to upper triangular form using
351         * orthogonal transformations. It is usually followed by qzit, qzval and,
352         * possibly, qzvec.
353         * </p>
354         * <p>
355         * On output:
356         * </p>
357         * <ul>
358         * <li><strong>a</strong> has been reduced to upper hessenberg form. The
359         * elements below the first subdiagonal have been set to zero.</li>
360         * 
361         * <li><strong>b</strong> has been reduced to upper triangular form. The
362         * elements below the main diagonal have been set to zero.</li>
363         * 
364         * <li><strong>z</strong> contains the product of the right hand transformations
365         * if matz has been set to true. Otherwise, <strong>z</strong> is not
366         * referenced.</li>
367         * </ul>
368         * 
369         * 
370         * @param a    contains a real general matrix.
371         * @param b    contains a real general matrix.
372         * @param matz should be set to true if the right hand transformations are to be
373         *             accumulated for later use in computing eigenvectors, and to false
374         *             otherwise.
375         * @param z    on output, contains the product of the right hand transformations if matz
376         *             has been set to true. Otherwise, z is not referenced.
377         */
378        static void qzhes(double[][] a, double[][] b, boolean matz, double[][] z) {
379                
380                final int n = a.length;
381                
382                int i, j, k, l, nm1, nm2;
383                double r, s, t;
384                int l1;
385                double u1, u2, v1, v2;
386                int lb, nk1;
387                double rho;
388        
389                // initialize z (with identity matrix)
390                if (matz) {
391                        for (j = 0; j < n; j++) {
392                                for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
393                                        z[i][j] = 0.0;
394                                }       //      L2
395                                z[j][j] = 1.0;
396                        }       // L3
397                }
398        
399                // L10: reduce b to upper triangular form
400                if (n <= 1) {
401                        return;
402                }
403                
404                nm1 = n - 1;    // TODO: check!!
405                
406                for (l = 0; l < nm1; l++) {
407                        l1 = l + 1;
408                        s = 0.0;
409        
410                        for (i = l1; i < n; i++) {
411                                s = s + Math.abs(b[i][l]);
412                        }       // L20
413        
414                        if (s != 0.0) {         
415                                s = s + Math.abs(b[l][l]);
416                                r = 0.0;
417                                for (i = l; i < n; i++) {
418                                        b[i][l] = b[i][l] / s;
419                                        r = r + b[i][l] * b[i][l];
420                                }       // L25
421                
422                                r = Math.copySign(Math.sqrt(r), b[l][l]);
423                                b[l][l] = b[l][l] + r;
424                                rho = r * b[l][l];
425                
426                                for (j = l1; j < n; j++) {
427                                        t = 0.0;        // dot product
428                                        for (i = l; i < n; i++) {
429                                                t = t + b[i][l] * b[i][j];
430                                        }       //L30
431                                        t = -t / rho;
432                                        
433                                        for (i = l; i < n; i++) {
434                                                b[i][j] = b[i][j] + t * b[i][l];
435                                        }       // L40
436                                        
437                                }       // L50
438                
439                                for (j = 0; j < n; j++) {
440                                        t = 0.0;        // dot product
441                                        for (i = l; i < n; i++) {
442                                                t = t + b[i][l] * a[i][j];
443                                        }       // L60
444                                        
445                                        t = -t / rho;
446                                        
447                                        for (i = l; i < n; i++) {
448                                                a[i][j] = a[i][j] + t * b[i][l];
449                                        }       // L70
450                                        
451                                }       // L80
452                
453                                b[l][l] = -s * r;
454                                for (i = l1; i < n; i++) {
455                                        b[i][l] = 0.0;
456                                }       // L90
457                        
458                        }       // end if               
459                }       // L100
460        
461                // reduce a to upper Hessenberg form, while keeping b triangular
462                if (n == 2) {
463                        return;
464                }
465                nm2 = n - 2;
466                
467                for (k = 0; k < nm2; k++) {
468                        nk1 = nm1 - k - 1; // = n - 2 - k;
469        
470                        // for l=n-1 step -1 until k+1 do
471                        for (lb = 0; lb < nk1; lb++) {
472                                l = n - lb - 2;                                 // TODO: check!!
473                                l1 = l + 1;
474        
475                                // zero a(l+1,k)
476                                s = Math.abs(a[l][k]) + Math.abs(a[l1][k]);
477                                if (s == 0.0) {
478                                        continue;       // goto 150
479                                }
480                                u1 = a[l][k] / s;
481                                u2 = a[l1][k] / s;
482                                r = Math.copySign(Math.hypot(u1, u2), u1); 
483                                v1 = -(u1 + r) / r;
484                                v2 = -u2 / r;
485                                u2 = v2 / v1;
486        
487                                for (j = k; j < n; j++) {
488                                        t = a[l][j] + u2 * a[l1][j];
489                                        a[l][j] = a[l][j] + t * v1;
490                                        a[l1][j] = a[l1][j] + t * v2;
491                                }       // L110
492        
493                                a[l1][k] = 0.0;
494        
495                                for (j = l; j < n; j++) {
496                                        t = b[l][j] + u2 * b[l1][j];
497                                        b[l][j] = b[l][j] + t * v1;
498                                        b[l1][j] = b[l1][j] + t * v2;
499                                }       // L120
500        
501                                // zero b(l+1,l)
502                                s = Math.abs(b[l1][l1]) + Math.abs(b[l1][l]);
503                                if (s == 0.0) {
504                                        continue;       // go to 150
505                                }
506                                u1 = b[l1][l1] / s;
507                                u2 = b[l1][l] / s;
508                                r = Math.copySign(Math.hypot(u1, u2), u1);
509                                v1 = -(u1 + r) / r;
510                                v2 = -u2 / r;
511                                u2 = v2 / v1;
512        
513                                for (i = 0; i <= l1; i++) {
514                                        t = b[i][l1] + u2 * b[i][l];
515                                        b[i][l1] = b[i][l1] + t * v1;
516                                        b[i][l] = b[i][l] + t * v2;
517                                }       // L130
518        
519                                b[l1][l] = 0.0;
520        
521                                for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
522                                        t = a[i][l1] + u2 * a[i][l];
523                                        a[i][l1] = a[i][l1] + t * v1;
524                                        a[i][l] = a[i][l] + t * v2;
525                                }       // L140
526        
527                                if (matz) {
528                                        for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
529                                                t = z[i][l1] + u2 * z[i][l];
530                                                z[i][l1] = z[i][l1] + t * v1;
531                                                z[i][l] = z[i][l] + t * v2;
532                                        }       // L145
533                                }
534                        }       // L150
535                }       // L160
536        
537        } // end of qzhes
538
539}
540
541//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
542
543abstract class QZIT {
544        
545        // EISPACK Routines, see http://www.netlib.org/eispack/
546
547        /**
548         * <p>
549         * This subroutine is the second step of the qz algorithm for solving
550         * generalized matrix eigenvalue problems, Siam J. Numer. anal. 10,
551         * 241-256(1973) by Moler and Stewart, as modified in technical note NASA TN
552         * D-7305(1973) by Ward. 
553         * This description has been adapted from the original version
554         * (dated August 1983).
555         * </p>
556         * <p>
557         * This subroutine accepts a pair of real matrices, one of them in upper
558         * Hessenberg form and the other in upper triangular form. It reduces the
559         * Hessenberg matrix to quasi-triangular form using orthogonal transformations
560         * while maintaining the triangular form of the other matrix. It is usually
561         * preceded by qzhes and followed by qzval and, possibly, qzvec.
562         * </p>
563         * <p>
564         * On output:
565         * </p>
566         * <ul>
567         * <li><strong>a</strong> has been reduced to quasi-triangular form. The elements 
568         * below the first subdiagonal are still zero and no two consecutive subdiagonal
569         * elements are nonzero.</li>
570         * 
571         * <li><strong>b</strong> is still in upper triangular form, although its elements have been altered.
572         * the location b(n,1) is used to store eps1 times the norm of b for later use
573         * by qzval and qzvec.
574         * 
575         * <li><strong>z</strong> contains the product of the right hand transformations (for both steps) if
576         * matz has been set to true.</li>
577         * </ul>
578         * 
579         * 
580         * @param a    contains a real upper hessenberg matrix.
581         * @param b    contains a real upper triangular matrix.
582         * @param eps1 is a tolerance used to determine negligible elements. eps1 = 0.0
583         *             (or negative) may be input, in which case an element will be
584         *             neglected only if it is less than roundoff error times the norm
585         *             of its matrix. If the input eps1 is positive, then an element
586         *             will be considered negligible if it is less than eps1 times the
587         *             norm of its matrix. A positive value of eps1 may result in faster
588         *             execution, but less accurate results.
589         * @param matz should be set to true if the right hand transformations are to be
590         *             accumulated for later use in computing eigenvectors, and to false
591         *             otherwise.
592         * @param z    contains, if matz has been set to true, the transformation matrix
593         *             produced in the reduction by qzhes, if performed, or else the
594         *             identity matrix. If matz has been set to false, z is not
595         *             referenced.
596         * @return -1 for normal return, j if the limit of 30*n iterations is exhausted
597         *         while the j-th eigenvalue is being sought.
598         */
599        static int qzit(double[][] a, double[][] b, double eps1, boolean matz, double[][] z) {
600
601                final int n = a.length;
602                
603                int i, j, k, l = 0;
604                double r, s, t, a1 = 0, a2 = 0, a3 = 0;
605                int k1, k2, l1 = 0, ll;
606                double u1, u2, u3;
607                double v1, v2, v3;
608                double a11 = 0, a12, a21 = 0, a22, a33 = 0, a34 = 0, a43 = 0, a44 = 0;
609                double b11 = 0, b12, b22 = 0, b33, b34 = 0, b44;
610                int na = 0, en, ld = 0;
611                double ep;
612                double sh = 0;
613                int km1, lm1 = 0;
614                double ani, bni;
615                int ish = 0, itn, its = 0, enm2 = 0, lor1;
616                double epsa, epsb, anorm, bnorm;
617                int enorn;
618                boolean notlas;
619        
620                int ierr = -1;          // no error 
621        
622                // compute epsa and epsb
623                anorm = 0.0;
624                bnorm = 0.0;
625                              
626                for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
627                        ani = 0.0;
628                        if (i != 0) {
629                                ani = (Math.abs(a[i][(i - 1)]));
630                        }
631                        bni = 0.0;
632                        
633                        for (j = i; j < n; j++) {
634                                ani += Math.abs(a[i][j]);
635                                bni += Math.abs(b[i][j]);
636                        }
637        
638                        if (ani > anorm) {
639                                anorm = ani;
640                        }
641                        if (bni > bnorm) {
642                                bnorm = bni;
643                        }
644                }
645        
646                if (anorm == 0.0) {
647                        anorm = 1.0;
648                }
649                if (bnorm == 0.0) {
650                        bnorm = 1.0;
651                }
652        
653//              ep = eps1;
654//              if (ep == 0.0) {
655//                      // use round-off level if eps1 is zero
656//                      ep = epsilon(1.0);
657//              }
658                ep = (eps1 > 0) ? eps1 : epslon(1.0);
659                epsa = ep * anorm;
660                epsb = ep * bnorm;
661        
662                // rReduce a to quasi-triangular form, while keeping b triangular
663                lor1 = 0;
664                enorn = n;
665                en = n - 1;
666                itn = n * 30;
667                
668                // ------------------------------------------
669        
670                State state = State.L60;
671                StateLoop: while (state != State.Final) {
672                        switch (state) {
673        
674                        case L60: 
675                                // Begin QZ step
676                                if (en <= 1) {
677                                        state = State.L1001;
678                                        break;
679                                }
680                                if (!matz) {
681                                        enorn = en + 1;
682                                }
683                                its = 0;
684                                na = en - 1;
685                                enm2 = na;
686                                state = State.L70;
687                                break;
688        
689                        case L70:
690                                ish = 2;
691                                // check for convergence or reducibility.
692                                for (ll = 0; ll <= en; ++ll) {
693                                        lm1 = en - ll - 1;
694                                        l = lm1 + 1;
695                                        if (l == 0) {
696                                                state = State.L95;
697                                                continue StateLoop;             // check again!!
698                                        }
699                                        if (Math.abs(a[l][lm1]) <= epsa) {
700                                                state = State.L90;
701                                                break;
702                                        }
703                                }
704                                state = State.L90;
705                                break;
706        
707                        case L90:
708                                a[l][lm1] = 0.0;
709                                if (l < na) {
710                                        state = State.L95;
711                                        break;
712                                }
713                                // 1-by-1 or 2-by-2 block isolated
714                                en = lm1;
715                                state = State.L60;
716                                break;
717        
718                        case L95: 
719                                // check for small top of b
720                                ld = l;
721                                state = State.L100;
722                                break;
723        
724                        case L100:
725                                l1 = l + 1;
726                                b11 = b[l][l];
727        
728                                if (Math.abs(b11) > epsb) {
729                                        state = State.L120;
730                                        break;
731                                }
732        
733                                b[l][l] = 0.0;
734                                s = Math.abs(a[l][l]) + Math.abs(a[l1][l]);
735                                u1 = a[l][l] / s;
736                                u2 = a[l1][l] / s;
737//                              r = Special.Sign(Math.sqrt(u1 * u1 + u2 * u2), u1);
738                                r = Math.copySign(Math.hypot(u1, u2), u1);
739                                v1 = -(u1 + r) / r;
740                                v2 = -u2 / r;
741                                u2 = v2 / v1;
742        
743                                for (j = l; j < enorn; j++) {
744                                        t = a[l][j] + u2 * a[l1][j];
745                                        a[l][j] = a[l][j] + t * v1;
746                                        a[l1][j] = a[l1][j] + t * v2;
747        
748                                        t = b[l][j] + u2 * b[l1][j];
749                                        b[l][j] = b[l][j] + t * v1;
750                                        b[l1][j] = b[l1][j] + t * v2;
751                                }
752        
753                                if (l != 0) {
754                                        a[l][lm1] = -a[l][lm1];
755                                }
756                                lm1 = l;
757                                l = l1;
758                                state = State.L90;
759                                break;
760        
761                        case L120:
762                                a11 = a[l][l] / b11;
763                                a21 = a[l1][l] / b11;
764                                if (ish == 1) {
765                                        state = State.L140;
766                                        break;
767                                }
768                                // iteration strategy
769                                if (itn == 0) {
770                                        state = State.L1000;
771                                        break;
772                                }
773                                if (its == 10) {
774                                        state = State.L155;
775                                        break;
776                                }
777        
778                                // determine type of shift
779                                b22 = b[l1][l1];
780                                if (Math.abs(b22) < epsb) {
781                                        b22 = epsb;
782                                }
783                                b33 = b[na][na];
784                                if (Math.abs(b33) < epsb) {
785                                        b33 = epsb;
786                                }
787                                b44 = b[en][en];
788                                if (Math.abs(b44) < epsb)
789                                        b44 = epsb;
790                                a33 = a[na][na] / b33;
791                                a34 = a[na][en] / b44;
792                                a43 = a[en][na] / b33;
793                                a44 = a[en][en] / b44;
794                                b34 = b[na][en] / b44;
795                                t = 0.5 * (a43 * b34 - a33 - a44);
796                                r = t * t + a34 * a43 - a33 * a44;
797                                if (r < 0.0) {
798                                        state = State.L150;
799                                        break;
800                                }
801        
802                                // determine single shift zero-th column of a
803                                ish = 1;
804                                r = Math.sqrt(r);
805                                sh = -t + r;
806                                s = -t - r;
807                                if (Math.abs(s - a44) < Math.abs(sh - a44)) {
808                                        sh = s;
809                                }
810        
811                                // look for two consecutive small sub-diagonal elements of a.
812                                for (ll = ld; ll < enm2; ll++) {
813                                        l = enm2 + ld - ll - 1;
814                                        if (l == ld) {
815                                                state = State.L140;
816                                                //break loop130;
817                                                continue StateLoop;
818                                        }
819                                        lm1 = l - 1;
820                                        l1 = l + 1;
821//                                      t = a[l + 1][l + 1];    // CHECK THIS!!
822                                        t = a[l][l];
823        
824                                        if (Math.abs(b[l][l]) > epsb) {
825                                                t = t - sh * b[l][l];
826                                        }
827        
828                                        if (Math.abs(a[l][lm1]) <= Math.abs(t / a[l1][l]) * epsa) {
829                                                state = State.L100;
830                                                continue StateLoop;
831                                        }
832                                }
833                                state = State.L140;
834                                break;
835        
836                        case L140:
837                                a1 = a11 - sh;
838                                a2 = a21;
839                                if (l != ld) {
840                                        a[l][lm1] = -a[l][lm1];
841                                }
842                                state = State.L160;
843                                break;
844        
845                        case L150: 
846                                // determine double shift zero-th column of a
847                                a12 = a[l][l1] / b22;
848                                a22 = a[l1][l1] / b22;
849                                b12 = b[l][l1] / b22;
850                                a1 = ((a33 - a11) * (a44 - a11) - a34 * a43 + a43 * b34 * a11) / a21 + a12 - a11 * b12;
851                                a2 = a22 - a11 - a21 * b12 - (a33 - a11) - (a44 - a11) + a43 * b34;
852                                a3 = a[l1 + 1][l1] / b22;
853                                state = State.L160;
854                                break;
855        
856                        case L155: 
857                                // ad hoc shift
858                                a1 = 0.0;
859                                a2 = 1.0;
860                                a3 = 1.1605;                    // magic!
861                                state = State.L160;
862                                break;
863        
864                        case L160:
865                                its = its + 1;
866                            itn = itn - 1;
867                                if (!matz) {
868                                        lor1 = ld;
869                                }
870        
871                                mainloop: for (k = l; k <= na; k++) {
872                                        notlas = (k != na && ish == 2);
873                                        k1 = k + 1;
874                                        k2 = k + 2;
875                                        km1 = Math.max(k, l + 1) - 1;
876                                        ll = Math.min(en, k1 + ish);
877        
878                                        if (!notlas) {
879                                                // zero a(k+1,k-1)
880                                                if (k != l) {
881                                                        a1 = a[k][km1];
882                                                        a2 = a[k1][km1];
883                                                }
884        
885                                                s = Math.abs(a1) + Math.abs(a2);
886                                                if (s == 0.0) {
887                                                        state = State.L70;
888                                                        continue StateLoop;
889                                                }
890                                                u1 = a1 / s;
891                                                u2 = a2 / s;
892                                                r = Math.copySign(Math.hypot(u1, u2), u1);
893                                                v1 = -(u1 + r) / r;
894                                                v2 = -u2 / r;
895                                                u2 = v2 / v1;
896        
897                                                for (j = km1; j < enorn; j++) {
898                                                        t = a[k][j] + u2 * a[k1][j];
899                                                        a[k][j] = a[k][j] + t * v1;
900                                                        a[k1][j] = a[k1][j] + t * v2;
901        
902                                                        t = b[k][j] + u2 * b[k1][j];
903                                                        b[k][j] = b[k][j] + t * v1;
904                                                        b[k1][j] = b[k1][j] + t * v2;
905                                                }
906        
907                                                if (k != l) {
908                                                        a[k1][km1] = 0.0;
909                                                }
910                                                // goto L240;
911                                        }
912        
913                                        else {
914                                                // zero a(k+1,k-1) and a(k+2,k-1)
915                                                //L190:
916                                                if (k != l) {
917                                                        a1 = a[k][km1];
918                                                        a2 = a[k1][km1];
919                                                        a3 = a[k2][km1];
920                                                }
921                                                //L200:
922                                                s = Math.abs(a1) + Math.abs(a2) + Math.abs(a3);
923                                                if (s == 0.0) {
924                                                        continue mainloop;      // goto L260;
925                                                }
926                                                u1 = a1 / s;
927                                                u2 = a2 / s;
928                                                u3 = a3 / s;
929                                                r = Math.copySign(Math.sqrt(u1 * u1 + u2 * u2 + u3 * u3), u1);
930                                                v1 = -(u1 + r) / r;
931                                                v2 = -u2 / r;
932                                                v3 = -u3 / r;
933                                                u2 = v2 / v1;
934                                                u3 = v3 / v1;
935        
936                                                for (j = km1; j < enorn; j++) {
937                                                        t = a[k][j] + u2 * a[k1][j] + u3 * a[k2][j];
938                                                        a[k][j] = a[k][j] + t * v1;
939                                                        a[k1][j] = a[k1][j] + t * v2;
940                                                        a[k2][j] = a[k2][j] + t * v3;
941        
942                                                        t = b[k][j] + u2 * b[k1][j] + u3 * b[k2][j];
943                                                        b[k][j] = b[k][j] + t * v1;
944                                                        b[k1][j] = b[k1][j] + t * v2;
945                                                        b[k2][j] = b[k2][j] + t * v3;
946                                                }
947        
948                                                if (k != l) {
949                                                        a[k1][km1] = 0.0;
950                                                        a[k2][km1] = 0.0;
951                                                }
952        
953                                                // zero b(k+2,k+1) and b(k+2,k)
954                                                s = Math.abs(b[k2][k2]) + Math.abs(b[k2][k1]) + Math.abs(b[k2][k]);
955                                                if (s != 0.0) {
956                                                        u1 = b[k2][k2] / s;
957                                                        u2 = b[k2][k1] / s;
958                                                        u3 = b[k2][k] / s;
959                                                        r = Math.copySign(Math.sqrt(u1 * u1 + u2 * u2 + u3 * u3), u1);
960                                                        v1 = -(u1 + r) / r;
961                                                        v2 = -u2 / r;
962                                                        v3 = -u3 / r;
963                                                        u2 = v2 / v1;
964                                                        u3 = v3 / v1;
965        
966                                                        for (i = lor1; i < ll + 1; i++) {
967                                                                t = a[i][k2] + u2 * a[i][k1] + u3 * a[i][k];
968                                                                a[i][k2] = a[i][k2] + t * v1;
969                                                                a[i][k1] = a[i][k1] + t * v2;
970                                                                a[i][k] = a[i][k] + t * v3;
971        
972                                                                t = b[i][k2] + u2 * b[i][k1] + u3 * b[i][k];
973                                                                b[i][k2] = b[i][k2] + t * v1;
974                                                                b[i][k1] = b[i][k1] + t * v2;
975                                                                b[i][k] = b[i][k] + t * v3;
976                                                        }
977        
978                                                        b[k2][k] = 0.0;
979                                                        b[k2][k1] = 0.0;
980        
981                                                        if (matz) {
982                                                                for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
983                                                                        t = z[i][k2] + u2 * z[i][k1] + u3 * z[i][k];
984                                                                        z[i][k2] = z[i][k2] + t * v1;
985                                                                        z[i][k1] = z[i][k1] + t * v2;
986                                                                        z[i][k] = z[i][k] + t * v3;
987                                                                }
988                                                        }
989                                                }
990                                        }
991        
992                                        // L240:
993                                        // zero b(k+1,k)
994                                        s = (Math.abs(b[k1][k1])) + (Math.abs(b[k1][k]));
995                                        if (s == 0.0) {
996                                                continue;       // goto L260;
997                                        }
998                                        u1 = b[k1][k1] / s;
999                                        u2 = b[k1][k] / s;
1000                                        r = Math.copySign(Math.hypot(u1, u2), u1);
1001                                        v1 = -(u1 + r) / r;
1002                                        v2 = -u2 / r;
1003                                        u2 = v2 / v1;
1004        
1005                                        for (i = lor1; i <= ll; i++) {
1006                                                t = a[i][k1] + u2 * a[i][k];
1007                                                a[i][k1] = a[i][k1] + t * v1;
1008                                                a[i][k] = a[i][k] + t * v2;
1009        
1010                                                t = b[i][k1] + u2 * b[i][k];
1011                                                b[i][k1] = b[i][k1] + t * v1;
1012                                                b[i][k] = b[i][k] + t * v2;
1013                                        }
1014        
1015                                        b[k1][k] = 0.0;
1016        
1017                                        if (matz) {
1018                                                for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
1019                                                        t = z[i][k1] + u2 * z[i][k];
1020                                                        z[i][k1] = z[i][k1] + t * v1;
1021                                                        z[i][k] = z[i][k] + t * v2;
1022                                                }
1023                                        }
1024                                        // L260: ;
1025                                }
1026        
1027                                state = State.L70; // end qz step
1028                                break;
1029        
1030                        case L1000: 
1031                                // set error -- all eigenvalues have not converged after 30*n iterations
1032                                ierr = en + 1;
1033                                state = State.L1001;
1034                                break;
1035        
1036                        case L1001: 
1037                                // save epsb for use by qzval and qzvec
1038                                if (n > 1) {
1039                                        b[n - 1][0] = epsb;
1040                                }
1041                                state = State.Final;
1042                                break;
1043        
1044                        case Final:
1045                                throw new RuntimeException("this should never happen!");
1046                        }
1047                }
1048        
1049                return ierr;    // return eigenvalue index if iteration count exceeded
1050        } // end of qzit()
1051        
1052
1053        private enum State {
1054                L60, L70, L90, L95, L100, L120, L140, L150, L155, L160, L1000, L1001, Final;
1055        }
1056
1057        private static double EpsDouble;
1058        static {
1059                double eps;
1060                double a = 4.0 / 3.0;
1061                do {
1062                        double b = a - 1.0;
1063                        double c = b + b + b;
1064                        eps = Math.abs(c - 1.0);
1065                } while (eps == 0);
1066                EpsDouble = eps;
1067        }
1068        
1069        private static float EpsFloat;
1070        static {
1071                float eps;
1072                float a = 4.0f / 3.0f;
1073                do {
1074                        float b = a - 1.0f;
1075                        float c = b + b + b;
1076                        eps = Math.abs(c - 1.0f);
1077                } while (eps == 0);
1078                EpsFloat = eps;
1079        }
1080 
1081        /**
1082         * Estimates unit round-off in quantities of size x.
1083         * This is a port of the epsilon function from EISPACK.
1084         * See also
1085         * https://www.researchgate.net/publication/2860253_A_Comment_on_the_Eispack_Machine_Epsilon_Routine
1086         * 
1087         * @param x some quantity
1088         * @return returns the smallest number e of the same kind as x such that 1 + e > 1.
1089         */
1090        private static double epslon(double x) {
1091//              double eps;
1092//              double a = 4.0 / 3.0;
1093//              do {
1094//                      double b = a - 1.0;
1095//                      double c = b + b + b;
1096//                      eps = Math.abs(c - 1.0);
1097//              } while (eps == 0);
1098                return EpsDouble * Math.abs(x);
1099        }
1100        
1101        private static float epslon(float x) {
1102                return EpsFloat * Math.abs(x);
1103                
1104        }
1105        
1106/* original FORTRAN code:
1107           a = 4.0d0/3.0d0
1108        10 b = a - 1.0d0
1109           c = b + b + b
1110           eps = dabs(c-1.0d0)
1111           if (eps .eq. 0.0d0) go to 10
1112           epslon = eps*dabs(x)
1113           return
1114           end
1115*/
1116        
1117/*
1118program test_epsilon
1119    real :: x = 3.143
1120    real(8) :: y = 2.33
1121    print *, epsilon(x)
1122    print *, epsilon(y)
1123end program test_epsilon
1124 */
1125        
1126        public static void main(String[] args) {
1127                double x = 3.143;
1128                System.out.println(epslon(x));
1129                float y = 2.33f;
1130                System.out.println(epslon(y));
1131                
1132        }
1133
1134}
1135
1136//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1137
1138abstract class QZVAL {
1139
1140        // EISPACK Routines, see http://www.netlib.org/eispack/
1141
1142        /**
1143         * <p>
1144         * This subroutine is the third step of the qz algorithm for solving generalized
1145         * matrix eigenvalue problems, Siam J. Numer. Anal. 10, 241-256 (1973) by Moler
1146         * and Stewart. This description has been adapted from the original version
1147         * (dated August 1983).
1148         * </p>
1149         * <p>
1150         * This subroutine accepts a pair of real matrices, one of them in
1151         * quasi-triangular form and the other in upper triangular form. it reduces the
1152         * quasi-triangular matrix further, so that any remaining 2-by-2 blocks
1153         * correspond to pairs of complex Eigenvalues, and returns quantities whose
1154         * ratios give the generalized eigenvalues. it is usually preceded by qzhes and
1155         * qzit and may be followed by qzvec.
1156         * </p>
1157         * <p>
1158         * On output:
1159         * </p>
1160         * <ul>
1161         * <li><strong>a</strong> has been reduced further to a quasi-triangular matrix
1162         * in which all nonzero subdiagonal elements correspond to pairs of complex
1163         * eigenvalues.</li>
1164         * 
1165         * <li><strong>b</strong> is still in upper triangular form, although its
1166         * elements have been altered. b[n-1][0] is unaltered.</li>
1167         * 
1168         * <li><strong>alfr</strong> and <strong>alfi</strong> contain the real and
1169         * imaginary parts of the diagonal elements of the triangular matrix that would
1170         * be obtained if a were reduced completely to triangular form by unitary
1171         * transformations. Non-zero values of <strong>alfi</strong> occur in pairs, the
1172         * first member positive and the second negative.</li>
1173         * 
1174         * <li><strong>beta</strong> contains the diagonal elements of the corresponding
1175         * <strong>b</strong>, normalized to be real and non-negative. The generalized
1176         * eigenvalues are then the ratios ((alfr + i * alfi) / beta).</li>
1177         * 
1178         * <li><strong>z</strong> contains the product of the right hand transformations
1179         * (for all three steps) if <strong>matz</strong> has been set to true.</li>
1180         * </ul>
1181         * 
1182         * @param a    contains a real upper quasi-triangular matrix.
1183         * @param b    contains a real upper triangular matrix. In addition, location
1184         *             b[n-1][0] contains the tolerance quantity (epsb) computed and
1185         *             saved in qzit.
1186         * @param alfr and alfi contain the real and imaginary parts of the diagonal
1187         *             elements of the triangular matrix that would be obtained if a
1188         *             were reduced completely to triangular form by unitary
1189         *             transformations. Non-zero values of <strong>alfi</strong> occur
1190         *             in pairs, the first member positive and the second negative.
1191         * @param alfi see description for <strong>alfr</strong>.
1192         * @param beta contains the diagonal elements of the corresponding
1193         *             <strong>b</strong>, normalized to be real and non-negative. The
1194         *             generalized eigenvalues are then the ratios ((alfr + i * alfi) / beta).
1195         * @param matz should be set to true. if the right hand transformations are to
1196         *             be accumulated for later use in computing eigenvectors, and to
1197         *             false otherwise.
1198         * @param z    contains, if <strong>matz</strong> has been set to true, the
1199         *             transformation matrix produced in the reductions by qzhes and
1200         *             qzit, if performed, or else the identity matrix. If
1201         *             <strong>matz</strong> has been set to false, z is not referenced.
1202         */
1203        @SuppressWarnings("unused")
1204        static void qzval(double[][] a, double[][] b, double[] alfr, double[] alfi, double[] beta, boolean matz,
1205                        double[][] z) {
1206
1207                final int n = a.length;
1208                
1209                int i = 0, j;
1210                int na = 0, en = 0, nn;
1211                double c = 0, d = 0, e = 0;
1212                double r, s, t;
1213                double a1 = 0, a2 = 0, u1, u2, v1, v2;
1214                double a11 = 0, a12 = 0, a21 = 0, a22 = 0;
1215                double b11 = 0, b12 = 0, b22 = 0;
1216                double di = 0, ei = 0;
1217                double an = 0, bn = 0;
1218                double cq = 0, dr = 0;
1219                double cz = 0, ti = 0, tr = 0;
1220                double a1i = 0, a2i = 0, a11i, a12i, a22i, a11r, a12r, a22r;
1221                double sqi = 0, ssi = 0, sqr = 0, szi = 0, ssr = 0, szr = 0;
1222
1223                double epsb = b[n - 1][0];
1224                int isw = 1;
1225
1226                // find eigenvalues of quasi-triangular matrices.
1227                for (nn = 0; nn < n; nn++) {
1228                        
1229                        State state = State.Linit;
1230                        StateLoop: while (state != State.Lfinal) {
1231                                
1232                                switch (state) {
1233                                case Linit:
1234                                        en = n - 1 - nn;        // TODO: check!!
1235                                        na = en - 1;
1236                                        if (isw == 2) {
1237                                                state = State.L505;
1238                                                break;
1239                                        }
1240                                        if (en == 0) {
1241                                                state = State.L410;
1242                                                break;
1243                                        }
1244                                        if (a[en][na] != 0.0) {
1245                                                state = State.L420;
1246                                                break;
1247                                        }
1248                                        state = State.L410;
1249                                        break;
1250
1251                                case L410:
1252                                        // 1-by-1 block, one real root
1253                                        alfr[en] = a[en][en];
1254                                        if (b[en][en] < 0.0) {
1255                                                alfr[en] = -alfr[en];
1256                                        }
1257                                        beta[en] = (Math.abs(b[en][en]));
1258                                        alfi[en] = 0.0;
1259                                        state = State.L510;
1260                                        break;
1261
1262                                case L420:
1263                                        // 2-by-2 block
1264                                        if (Math.abs(b[na][na]) <= epsb) {
1265                                                state = State.L455;
1266                                                break;
1267                                        }
1268                                        if (Math.abs(b[en][en]) > epsb) {
1269                                                state = State.L430;
1270                                                break;
1271                                        }
1272                                        a1 = a[en][en];
1273                                        a2 = a[en][na];
1274                                        bn = 0.0;
1275                                        state = State.L435;
1276                                        break;
1277
1278                                case L430:
1279                                        an = Math.abs(a[na][na]) + Math.abs(a[na][en]) + Math.abs(a[en][na]) + Math.abs(a[en][en]);
1280                                        bn = Math.abs(b[na][na]) + Math.abs(b[na][en]) + Math.abs(b[en][en]);
1281                                        a11 = a[na][na] / an;
1282                                        a12 = a[na][en] / an;
1283                                        a21 = a[en][na] / an;
1284                                        a22 = a[en][en] / an;
1285                                        b11 = b[na][na] / bn;
1286                                        b12 = b[na][en] / bn;
1287                                        b22 = b[en][en] / bn;
1288                                        e = a11 / b11;
1289                                        ei = a22 / b22;
1290                                        s = a21 / (b11 * b22);
1291                                        t = (a22 - e * b22) / b22;
1292
1293                                        if (Math.abs(e) > Math.abs(ei)) {
1294                                                e = ei;
1295                                                t = (a11 - e * b11) / b11;
1296                                        }
1297
1298                                        c = 0.5 * (t - s * b12);
1299                                        d = c * c + s * (a12 - e * b12);
1300
1301                                        if (d < 0.0) {
1302                                                state = State.L480;
1303                                                break;
1304                                        }
1305
1306                                        // two real roots. zero both a(en,na) and b(en,na)
1307                                        e = e + c + Math.copySign(Math.sqrt(d), c);
1308                                        a11 -= e * b11;
1309                                        a12 -= e * b12;
1310                                        a22 -= e * b22;
1311
1312                                        if (Math.abs(a11) + Math.abs(a12) < Math.abs(a21) + Math.abs(a22)) {
1313                                                a1 = a22;
1314                                                a2 = a21;
1315                                        } else {
1316                                                a1 = a12;
1317                                                a2 = a11;
1318                                        }
1319                                        state = State.L435;
1320                                        break;
1321
1322                                case L435:
1323                                        // choose and apply real z
1324                                        s = Math.abs(a1) + Math.abs(a2);
1325                                        u1 = a1 / s;
1326                                        u2 = a2 / s;
1327                                        r = Math.copySign(Math.hypot(u1, u2), u1);
1328                                        v1 = -(u1 + r) / r;
1329                                        v2 = -u2 / r;
1330                                        u2 = v2 / v1;
1331
1332                                        for (i = 0; i <= en; i++) {             // TODO: check!
1333                                                t = a[i][en] + u2 * a[i][na];
1334                                                a[i][en] = a[i][en] + t * v1;
1335                                                a[i][na] = a[i][na] + t * v2;
1336
1337                                                t = b[i][en] + u2 * b[i][na];
1338                                                b[i][en] = b[i][en] + t * v1;
1339                                                b[i][na] = b[i][na] + t * v2;
1340                                        }       // L440
1341
1342                                        if (matz) {
1343                                                for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
1344                                                        t = z[i][en] + u2 * z[i][na];
1345                                                        z[i][en] = z[i][en] + t * v1;
1346                                                        z[i][na] = z[i][na] + t * v2;
1347                                                }       // L445
1348                                        }
1349
1350                                        // L450
1351                                        if (bn == 0.0) {
1352                                                state = State.L475;
1353                                                break;
1354                                        }
1355                                        if (an < Math.abs(e) * bn) {
1356                                                state = State.L455;
1357                                                break;
1358                                        }
1359                                        a1 = b[na][na];
1360                                        a2 = b[en][na];
1361                                        state = State.L460;
1362                                        break;
1363
1364                                case L455:
1365                                        a1 = a[na][na];
1366                                        a2 = a[en][na];
1367                                        state = State.L475;
1368                                        break;
1369
1370                                case L460:
1371                                        // choose and apply real q
1372                                        s = Math.abs(a1) + Math.abs(a2);
1373                                        if (s == 0.0) {
1374                                                state = State.L475;
1375                                                break;
1376                                        }
1377                                        u1 = a1 / s;
1378                                        u2 = a2 / s;
1379                                        r = Math.copySign(Math.hypot(u1, u2), u1);
1380                                        v1 = -(u1 + r) / r;
1381                                        v2 = -u2 / r;
1382                                        u2 = v2 / v1;
1383
1384                                        for (j = na; j < n; j++) {
1385                                                t = a[na][j] + u2 * a[en][j];
1386                                                a[na][j] = a[na][j] + t * v1;
1387                                                a[en][j] = a[en][j] + t * v2;
1388
1389                                                t = b[na][j] + u2 * b[en][j];
1390                                                b[na][j] = b[na][j] + t * v1;
1391                                                b[en][j] = b[en][j] + t * v2;
1392                                        }       // L470
1393                                        
1394                                        state = State.L475;
1395                                        break;
1396
1397                                case L475:
1398                                        a[en][na] = 0.0;
1399                                        b[en][na] = 0.0;
1400                                        alfr[na] = a[na][na];
1401                                        alfr[en] = a[en][en];
1402
1403                                        if (b[na][na] < 0.0)
1404                                                alfr[na] = -alfr[na];
1405
1406                                        if (b[en][en] < 0.0)
1407                                                alfr[en] = -alfr[en];
1408
1409                                        beta[na] = (Math.abs(b[na][na]));
1410                                        beta[en] = (Math.abs(b[en][en]));
1411                                        alfi[en] = 0.0;
1412                                        alfi[na] = 0.0;
1413                                        state = State.L505;
1414                                        break;
1415
1416                                case L480:
1417                                        // two complex roots
1418                                        e = e + c;
1419                                        ei = Math.sqrt(-d);
1420                                        a11r = a11 - e * b11;
1421                                        a11i = ei * b11;
1422                                        a12r = a12 - e * b12;
1423                                        a12i = ei * b12;
1424                                        a22r = a22 - e * b22;
1425                                        a22i = ei * b22;
1426
1427                                        if (Math.abs(a11r) + Math.abs(a11i) + Math.abs(a12r) + Math.abs(a12i) < 
1428                                                Math.abs(a21) + Math.abs(a22r) + Math.abs(a22i)) {
1429                                                // L482;
1430                                                a1 = a22r;
1431                                                a1i = a22i;
1432                                                a2 = -a21;
1433                                                a2i = 0.0;
1434                                        } else {
1435                                                a1 = a12r;
1436                                                a1i = a12i;
1437                                                a2 = -a11r;
1438                                                a2i = -a11i;
1439                                        }
1440                                        // goto L485;
1441                                        state = State.L485;
1442                                        break;
1443
1444                                case L485:
1445                                        // choose complex z
1446                                        cz = Math.hypot(a1, a1i);
1447                                        if (cz == 0.0) {
1448                                                // L487
1449                                                szr = 1.0;
1450                                                szi = 0.0;
1451                                        } else {
1452                                                szr = (a1 * a2 + a1i * a2i) / cz;
1453                                                szi = (a1 * a2i - a1i * a2) / cz;
1454                                                r = Math.sqrt(cz * cz + szr * szr + szi * szi);
1455                                                cz = cz / r;
1456                                                szr = szr / r;
1457                                                szi = szi / r;
1458                                        }
1459
1460                                        // L490:
1461                                        if (an < (Math.abs(e) + ei) * bn) {
1462                                                // L492
1463                                                a1 = cz * a11 + szr * a12;
1464                                                a1i = szi * a12;
1465                                                a2 = cz * a21 + szr * a22;
1466                                                a2i = szi * a22;
1467                                        } else {
1468                                                a1 = cz * b11 + szr * b12;
1469                                                a1i = szi * b12;
1470                                                a2 = szr * b22;
1471                                                a2i = szi * b22;
1472                                        }
1473
1474                                        // L495: choose complex q
1475                                        cq = Math.hypot(a1, a1i);
1476                                        if (cq == 0.0) {
1477                                                sqr = 1.0;
1478                                                sqi = 0.0;
1479                                        } else {
1480                                                sqr = (a1 * a2 + a1i * a2i) / cq;
1481                                                sqi = (a1 * a2i - a1i * a2) / cq;
1482                                                r = Math.sqrt(cq * cq + sqr * sqr + sqi * sqi);
1483                                                cq = cq / r;
1484                                                sqr = sqr / r;
1485                                                sqi = sqi / r;
1486                                        }
1487
1488                                        // L500: compute diagonal elements that would result if transformations were applied
1489                                        ssr = sqr * szr + sqi * szi;
1490                                        ssi = sqr * szi - sqi * szr;
1491                                        i = 0;
1492                                        tr = cq * cz * a11 + cq * szr * a12 + sqr * cz * a21 + ssr * a22;
1493                                        ti = cq * szi * a12 - sqi * cz * a21 + ssi * a22;
1494                                        dr = cq * cz * b11 + cq * szr * b12 + ssr * b22;
1495                                        di = cq * szi * b12 + ssi * b22;
1496                                        state = State.L503;
1497                                        break;
1498
1499                                case L502:
1500                                        i = 1;
1501                                        tr = ssr * a11 - sqr * cz * a12 - cq * szr * a21 + cq * cz * a22;
1502                                        ti = -ssi * a11 - sqi * cz * a12 + cq * szi * a21;
1503                                        dr = ssr * b11 - sqr * cz * b12 + cq * cz * b22;
1504                                        di = -ssi * b11 - sqi * cz * b12;
1505                                        state = State.L503;
1506                                        break;
1507
1508                                case L503:
1509                                        t = ti * dr - tr * di;
1510                                        j = na;
1511                                        if (t < 0.0) {
1512                                                j = en;
1513                                        }
1514                                        r = Math.hypot(dr, di);
1515                                        beta[j] = bn * r;
1516                                        alfr[j] = an * (tr * dr + ti * di) / r;
1517                                        alfi[j] = an * t / r;
1518                                        if (i == 0) {
1519                                                // goto L502;
1520                                                state = State.L502;
1521                                                break;
1522                                        }
1523                                        state = State.L505;
1524                                        break;
1525
1526                                case L505:
1527                                        isw = 3 - isw;
1528                                        state = State.L510;
1529                                        break;
1530
1531                                case L510:
1532                                        state = State.Lfinal;
1533                                        break;
1534
1535                                case Lfinal:
1536                                        throw new RuntimeException("this should never happen!");
1537                                        //                                      break StateLoop;
1538                                }
1539                        }       // end StateLoop: while (state
1540
1541                }       // L510 end for (nn ..
1542
1543                b[n - 1][0] = epsb;
1544                
1545        } // end of qzval()
1546
1547        private enum State {
1548                Linit, Lfinal, L505, L410, L420, L455, L430, L435, L480, L475, L485, L503, L502, L460, L510
1549        }
1550
1551}
1552
1553//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1554
1555abstract class QZVEC {
1556        
1557        public static boolean VERBOSE = false;
1558
1559        // EISPACK Routines, see http://www.netlib.org/eispack/
1560
1561        /**
1562         * <p>
1563         * This subroutine is the optional fourth step of the qz algorithm for solving
1564         * generalized matrix eigenvalue problems, Siam J. Numer. Anal. 10, 241-256
1565         * (1973) by Moler and Stewart. This description has been adapted from the
1566         * original version (dated August 1983).
1567         * </p>
1568         * <p>
1569         * This subroutine accepts a pair of real matrices, one of them in
1570         * quasi-triangular form (in which each 2-by-2 block corresponds to a pair of
1571         * complex eigenvalues) and the other in upper triangular form. It computes the
1572         * eigenvectors of the triangular problem and transforms the results back to the
1573         * original coordinate system. It is usually preceded by qzhes, qzit, and qzval.
1574         * </p>
1575         * <p>
1576         * On output:
1577         * </p>
1578         * <ul>
1579         * <li><strong>a</strong> is unaltered. Its subdiagonal elements provide
1580         * information about the storage of the complex eigenvectors.</li>
1581         * 
1582         * <li><strong>b</strong> has been destroyed.</li>
1583         * 
1584         * <li><strong>alfr</strong>, <strong>alfi</strong> and <strong>beta</strong>
1585         * are unaltered.</li>
1586         * 
1587         * <li><strong>z</strong> contains the real and imaginary parts of the
1588         * eigenvectors. If alfi(i) = 0.0, the i-th eigenvalue is real and the i-th
1589         * column of z contains its eigenvector. if alfi(i) &ne; 0.0, the i-th
1590         * eigenvalue is complex. if alfi(i) &gt; 0.0, the eigenvalue is the first of a
1591         * complex pair and the i-th and (i+1)-th columns of z contain its eigenvector.
1592         * if alfi(i) &lt; 0.0, the eigenvalue is the second of a complex pair and the
1593         * (i-1)-th and i-th columns of z contain the conjugate of its eigenvector. Each
1594         * eigenvector is normalized so that the modulus of its largest component is
1595         * 1.0.</li>
1596         * </ul>
1597         * 
1598         * @param a    contains a real upper quasi-triangular matrix.
1599         * @param b    contains a real upper triangular matrix. In addition, location
1600         *             b[n-1][0] contains the tolerance quantity (epsb) computed and
1601         *             saved in qzit.
1602         * @param alfr , <strong>alfi</strong>, and <strong>beta</strong> are vectors
1603         *             with components whose ratios ((alfr + i * alfi) / beta) are the
1604         *             generalized eigenvalues. They are usually obtained from qzval.
1605         * @param alfi see <strong>alfr</strong>
1606         * @param beta see <strong>alfr</strong>
1607         * @param z    contains the transformation matrix produced in the reductions by
1608         *             qzhes, qzit, and qzval, if performed. If the eigenvectors of the
1609         *             triangular problem are desired, z must contain the identity
1610         *             matrix.
1611         */
1612        @SuppressWarnings("unused")
1613        static void qzvec(double[][] a, double[][] b, double[] alfr, double[] alfi, double[] beta, double[][] z) {
1614
1615                final int n = a.length;
1616
1617                int i = 0, j, k, m;
1618                int na = 0, ii, en = 0, jj, nn, enm2;
1619                double d = 0, q;
1620                double r = 0, s = 0, t = 0, w = 0, x = 0, y = 0, t1 = 0, t2 = 0, w1 = 0, x1 = 0, z1 = 0, di = 0;
1621                double ra = 0, dr = 0, sa = 0;
1622                double ti = 0, rr, tr = 0, zz = 0;
1623                double alfm, almi, betm, almr;
1624
1625                double epsb = b[n - 1][0];
1626                int isw = 1;
1627
1628                if (VERBOSE) System.out.println("QZVEC: starting Loop A ***********************");
1629                LoopA: for (nn = 0; nn < n; nn++) {
1630
1631                        StateA stateA = StateA.Ainit;
1632                        StateLoopA: while (stateA != StateA.Afinal) {
1633
1634                                switch(stateA) {
1635                                case Ainit :
1636                                        en = n - 1 - nn;        // TODO: check!!
1637                                        na = en - 1;
1638                                        if (isw == 2) {
1639                                                stateA = StateA.A795;
1640                                                break;
1641                                        }
1642                                        if (alfi[en] != 0.0) {
1643                                                stateA = StateA.A710;
1644                                                break;
1645                                        }
1646
1647                                        // Real vector
1648                                        m = en;
1649                                        b[en][en] = 1.0;
1650                                        if (na == -1) {
1651                                                stateA = StateA.A800;
1652                                                break;
1653                                        }
1654                                        alfm = alfr[m];
1655                                        betm = beta[m];
1656
1657                                        if (VERBOSE) System.out.println("QZVEC: starting Loop B ***********************");
1658                                        
1659                                        // for i=en-1 step -1 until 1 do --
1660                                        LoopB: for (ii = 0; ii <= na; ii++) {
1661                                                
1662                                                StateB stateB = StateB.Binit;
1663                                                StateLoopB: while (stateB != StateB.Bfinal) {
1664                                                        switch (stateB) {
1665                                                        case Binit :
1666                                                                i = en - ii - 1;
